comment: Super chill. Good class. Only bad thing is attendance is mandatory. My grade was dropped due to attendance.

One of the easiest courses and best professor I ever had. She's understanding and caring for her students. I had fun in all her class and even her project is fun to work on. The tests are fairly easy and there are extra credit opportunities that are also enjoyable to do. I would take her again!
She was incredibly understanding and the homework is a lot but prepares you well for the exams. Overall a great course and a great professor!

Ridiculously easy course. Kind woman, but expects you to write a lot on very little when it comes to the healthy living check-ins. Just take notes on the modules and you'll pass the module quizzes. Google was a great resource. Not required to graduate the university anymore.

Gerda was an awesome professor! Shes so sweet & really does care about everyone passing the class. There a fun projects before each exam and lots of group work during the class usually; tests are fairly easy

Excellent professor! Lectures were top notch, TED Talks were in abundance, and she was quick to respond to emails. Very much enjoyed her class. Definitely buy the e-text book with online mastering health code.
While the class was not hard, I ended with an 79.5 and she would not round it up. I do not think this is fair at all.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: So glad I took Dr. Gerda! She is very understanding and as long as you are putting in effort she is willing to help you. Overall it was an easy class and an easy A!

Prof Gerda was a great instructor that helped me learn about the human body and how it works. Enjoyed it a lot and I had a chance to share with her my obstacle course race which she gave me credit on. Love her. Awesome professor.

Loved this professor! She's very kind and prompt to responding to emails and grading assignments. Every module is clearly organized and easy to follow along with. There's always a Healthy Living Check-In and multiple little assignments and readings. Tons of grades make up your final grade! fAn incredibly easy A if you do the work. Take this class!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Most people want a wellness professor that is an easy a, after reading these reviews I assumed thats how professor Gerda was, but man was I wrong. After putting way too much effort into her modules I still didnt end up with a B. She grades like she is teaching a biochem course. Avoid at all costs unless youre okay with a B in health.
Very kind woman. Willing to work with you and actually cares about her students. The class is a breeze as long as you keep up with your studying and assignments.

This semester I was involved in a pretty major car accident and hurt my back. This professor has worked with me to remake the assignments I was unable to do and has ensured that I felt comfortable doing it. This means a lot because many would say 'too bad' and allow me to fail. I definitely recommend her.

I took Professor Gerda my freshman year online. No tests, you just have to fill out a report like assignment for each module. She emails back quickly and she is very flexible with her office hours. This was my first online class in college and it was one of the best decisions I made. Take her and email her and also meet with her!

Professor Gerda is a sweetheart. She is very approachable and answers emails very quickly. For an online class with her, we just have assignments in the modules instead of tests. Let's you know exactly what she expects from you. If you read the text and put some effort into the assignments, you'll do fine.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Easy class.  No tests, just assignments for each section.  Her lectures can get a little boring but there is a lot of student involvement and group work.  Just make sure to answer questions thoroughly on the module assignments because she will deduct points if you half-ass it.

Professor Gerda is very sweet. Attendance is mandatory and she allows 2 absences before she deduces points from your grade. She has 2 tests (midterm and final) and a couple of webquests. Show up to class, ready the ppt and the textbook and you can get a B.

Went into the class thinking it was going to be a joke but her tests were pretty tough if you didn't study. Gives very long lectures and gets off topic very easily. She gives 3 tests and drops one. Attendance is not mandatory

Not too bad of a class. Prof Gerda is really sweet and wants everyone to do well. There is a big group project and big project for yourself, but they are not bad at all. Only 3 tests and some online stuff that is very easy. I would definitely take her again.
She is very nice and helpful. Class can be a bit boring but it's just because of the class not because of her. She gives study guides and posts her power points. I would take her again.

Super nice and approachable! Knows material well and loves what she teaches. 3 tests, drops lowest one. Lots of little assignments, but simple. Tests are easy if you study her powerpoints. extra credit opportunities. Mrs Gerda makes this class bearable! Reccommend. (Ps I only used the textbook for labs)

Mrs. Gerda is very sweet and understanding ! Posts powerpoints on D2l, drops  lowest 13 tests, provides extra credit opportunities! Labs are easy but she grades the SMART goals very precisely. Go to class(even though lecture can be a drag), Study the powerpoints, do practice ?s in the book, and an A is easily tangible. You'll learn a lot from her!

Boring class but we all need it. She is super nice and is willing to help. Easy if you go to class and pay attention but u can just read the chapters instead. Lots of labs in the book so get ready to do that. She loves group work.

Professor Gerda is really nice! She doesn't care much about attendance, but it is important that you show up on days when assignments are due or when there are in-class activities. She takes off points for late work, but grades fairly, so if you don't put the effort into your work it will show in your grade.
She knows her stuff and manages a classroom very well. Plenty of assignments to pad grades. Pretty enjoyable for a class like this.

She puts the power points on d2l. Don't attempt to take notes in class, though, because she goes way too fast. You do labs every so often and they are easy. The smart goals lab is the only one you will fail. Attendance is not mandatory. Just show up for tests and you will pass. This class is easy, but annoying.
